title: In-Between, DUMBO
summary: Shot on the streets of DUMBO, Brooklyn, this image captures an in-between moment where chance becomes part of the composition—wind, motion, and timing aligning into a single frame.
story: Inspired by the 1990s fashion photography of Peter Lindbergh—one of Alex Covo's key influences—this work embraces spontaneity. The wind lifts the model's hair in perfect sync, turning randomness into a quiet, cinematic punctuation.
technique: Street-location fashion portrait in black and white with an emphasis on natural movement and timing.
quote: The best moments are the ones you almost miss.

title: Urban Grit
summary: A raw street portrait capturing the edge and energy of NYC's urban landscape.
story: This image strips fashion down to its essential elements—attitude, texture, and contrast against concrete.
technique: High contrast black and white with emphasis on architectural framing.

title: Shadow Play
summary: Hard shadows cut across the frame, creating graphic patterns that merge with the model's silhouette.
story: Inspired by film noir aesthetics, this work uses light as a second subject.
technique: Dramatic shadow work using natural light and architectural elements.

title: Concrete Canvas
summary: Fashion against raw city infrastructure—steel, concrete, and the human form in dialogue.
story: The city becomes both backdrop and collaborator in this urban fashion moment.
technique: Location portrait utilizing industrial textures and natural city light.
